System components in the Cloud Service Provider´s area of responsibility are automatically monitored for compliance with hardening specifications. Deviations from the specifications are automatically reported to the appropriate departments of the Cloud Service Provider for immediate assessment and action.

anchor_text: The CSP shall document the incompatibility between access rights, and enforce these incompatibilities when access rights are granted or updated on a user account
target_text: Withdraw or adjust access rights as the task area changes: Access rights are promptly revoked if the job responsibilities of the Cloud Service Provider´s internal or external staff or the tasks of system components involved in the Cloud Service Provider´s automated authorisation processes change. Privileged access rights are adjusted or revoked within 48 hours after the change taking effect. All other access rights are adjusted or revoked within 14 days. After revocation, the procedure for granting user accounts and access rights (cf. IDM-02) must be repeated.

anchor_text: Information Security Risk Assessment and developing IT General Control Activities: As part of its annual information security risk assessment, management selects and develops manual and IT general control activities that contribute to the mitigation of identified risks.
target_text: Metrics system. Taking into account the security category of the system, are the necessary data collected to know the degree of implementation of the security measures that are applicable and, where appropriate, in the case of organizations within the scope of the ENS to provide the annual report required by article 32 (INES Report)?

anchor_text: Unique Customer Identifier and ID: [The Organization] requires unique customer identifiers for customer user accounts and prevents identifier reuse.
target_text: Authentication mechanisms (organization users). Are access control mechanisms implemented, aligned with the organization's employee/internal user registration and cancellation process?. Are credentials activated only when they are under the user's exclusive and effective control, or is a credential change forced upon first access? Before providing credentials to users, have they known and accepted the organization's security policy in the aspects that affect them? Does the user acknowledge that they have received the credentials and that they know and accept the obligations that their possession entails, in particular, the duty of diligent custody, protection of their confidentiality and immediate notification in the event of loss? Are credentials changed with the periodicity established by the organization's policy? Are credentials removed and disabled when the authenticating entity (person, computer, or process) terminates its relationship with the system? Are credentials disabled or regenerated when their loss or disclosure to unauthorized persons is detected or suspected? Are attacks that could reveal system information without actually accessing it being prevented? Is the information provided in the accesses restricted to the minimum essential? Is the number of allowed attempts limited, blocking the access opportunity once that number is exceeded, requiring the intervention of security administrators to reactivate the account? Does the system inform the user of their obligations immediately after gaining access?

anchor_text: Cryptographic Algorithm and Methods, Secure Data Transmission Protocols, Encryption at Rest: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: The CSP shall distinguish between trusted and untrusted networks, based on a risk assessment

anchor_text: The CSP shall perform a risk assessment according to RM-01 to assess and treat the risks on any project that may affect the provision of the cloud service, regardless of the nature of the project December 2020
target_text: Contact with Relevant Government Agencies and Interest Groups: The Cloud Service Provider leverages relevant authorities and interest groups in order to stay informed about current threats and vulnerabilities. The information flows into the procedures for handling risks (cf. OIS-06) and vulnerabilities (cf. OPS-19). If the cloud service is used by public sector organisations in Germany, the Cloud Service Provider leverages contacts with the National IT Situation Centre and the CERT Association of the BSI.

anchor_text: Confidential Information Agreement: As part of their onboarding process, contingent workers must sign the '[The Organization] Confidential Information Agreement: Individuals (Suppliers, Contractors, Independent Contractors, Consultants, and Partners),' which includes the '[The Organization] Supplier and Independent Consultant Job Practice and Behavior Guide' outlining expected behavior regarding data and information system usage. This agreement prohibits any disclosure of information and other data to which the employee has been granted access.
target_text: The verification of the acknowledgement defined in HR-03.4 shall be automatically monitored in the processes and automated systems used to grant access rights to employees.

anchor_text: SDLC Methodology: A formal [The Organization] development life cycle (SDLC) methodology is in place that governs the development, acquisition, implementation, changes (including emergency changes), and maintenance of information [The Organization] and related technology requirements.
target_text: SECURE DEVELOPMENT ENVIRONMENT: The development environment takes information security in consideration.

anchor_text: Security & Privacy Incident Response: Security incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The CSP shall establish a Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), which contributes to the coordinated resolution of security incidents

anchor_text: Building Fail-Safe Mechanisms: The supply of the data centers (e. g. water, electricity, temperature and moisture control) is secured, monitored, maintained and tested at regular intervals. The data center has been designed with automatic fail-safe mechanisms and other redundancies. Maintenance is performed by authorized personnel at designated intervals and targets recommended by the suppliers. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.
target_text: Custody. Is security guaranteed in the custody of information media?. Is due diligence and control applied to information media, whether fixed or removable, that remain under the responsibility of the organization, guaranteeing access control through physical or logical measures, as appropriate? Are the manufacturer's maintenance requirements respected, especially with regard to temperature, humidity and other environmental agents? If the custody of media is outsourced to a third entity, has a service contract or agreement been signed stating the security measures applied?

anchor_text: Building Safeguards: Environmental security measures and safeguards are in place to protect the premises or buildings that house sensitive or critical information against environmental threats or threats caused by humans.
target_text: The security requirements in PS-01.5 shall be based on the security objectives of the information security policy, identified protection requirements for the cloud service and the assessment of risks to physical and environmental security

anchor_text: Log Ambiguity: Log data generated allows an unambiguous identification of user accesses at the tenant level to support (forensic) analysis in the event of a security incident.
target_text: LOGGING AND MONITORING – CONFIGURATION: Access to the logging and monitoring system components and to their configuration is strictly restricted.

anchor_text: Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology: A documented Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The CSP shall review at least annually the design and implementation and configuration undertaken to monitor the connections in a risk-oriented manner, with regard to the defined security requirements

anchor_text: Infrastructure & Application patching: Infrastructure supporting the service, and applications are patched upon availability as a part of routine maintenance and as a result of identified vulnerabilities and supplier supplied patches to help ensure that applications and infrastructure network and system components supporting the service are hardened against security threats.
target_text: The service provider must subscribe to maintenance contracts to have the security updates of software installed on service system equipment.

anchor_text: Full Time Worker Termination: Upon termination, full-time employee access is revoked for employees in a timely manner.
target_text: ASSET CLASSIFICATION AND LABELLING: Assets are classified and, if possible, labelled. Classification and labelling of an asset reflect the protection needs of the information it processes, stores, or transmits.

anchor_text: The CSP shall document and implement procedures and technical safeguards to encrypt cloud customers' data during storage
target_text: Encryption of sensitive data for storage: The Cloud Service Provider has established procedures and technical safeguards to encrypt cloud customers´ data during storage. The private keys used for encryption are known only to the cloud customer in accordance with applicable legal and regulatory obligations and requirements. Exceptions follow a specified procedure. The procedures for the use of private keys, including any exceptions, must be contractually agreed with the cloud customer. The private keys used for encryption are known to the customer exclusively and without exception in accordance with applicable legal and regulatory obligations and requirements.

anchor_text: Legal & Regulatory Requirements for Continuity: [The Organization] maintains and documents a process to identify, have access to, and assess applicable legal and regulatory requirements relating to the continuity of its products and services, activities and resources. Such legal and regulatory requirements are reviewed at least annually to ensure the continuity of its products and services, activities and resources. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the documents themselves and Systems Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: Identification of applicable legal, regulatory, self-imposed or contractual requirements: The legal, regulatory, self-imposed and contractual requirements relevant to the information security of the cloud service as well as the Cloud Service Provider´s procedures for complying with these requirements are explicitly defined and documented.

anchor_text: ISMS Boundaries: Information Security Management System (ISMS) boundaries are formally defined in an ISMS scoping document.
target_text: The documentation shall include at least:  Scope of the ISMS (Section 4.3 of ISO/IEC 27001);  Declaration of applicability (Section 6.1.3), and  Results of the last management review (Section 9.3).

anchor_text: Building Fail-Safe Mechanisms: The supply of the data centers (e. g. water, electricity, temperature and moisture control) is secured, monitored, maintained and tested at regular intervals. The data center has been designed with automatic fail-safe mechanisms and other redundancies. Maintenance is performed by authorized personnel at designated intervals and targets recommended by the suppliers. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement the means to maintain temperature and humidity conditions adapted to equipment. In addition, it must implement measures to prevent air conditioning failures and limit the consequences.

anchor_text: Privileged Access to Production: Privileged access to in-scope system components and production environments is restricted to authorized and appropriate users only.
target_text: The service provider must keep the inventory of users up to date under its responsibility with administration rights on the resources of the service information system.

anchor_text: Infrastructure & Application patching: Infrastructure supporting the service, and applications are patched upon availability as a part of routine maintenance and as a result of identified vulnerabilities and supplier supplied patches to help ensure that applications and infrastructure network and system components supporting the service are hardened against security threats.
target_text: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

anchor_text: UserDisableMechanismAfterInactivity
target_text: The automated mechanism in IAM-03.1 shall block personal user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP after two (2) months of inactivity.

anchor_text: Cryptography Use: [The Organization] communicates to its cloud service customers when cryptography is used to protect the customer data and provides information and cryptographic technologies to cloud service customers to use.
target_text: The CSP shall document and implement a policy and procedures about authentication mechanisms, covering at least the following aspects:  The selection of mechanisms suitable for every type of account and each level of risk;  The protection of credentials used by the authentication mechanism;  The generation and distribution of credentials for new accounts;  Rules for the renewal of credentials, including periodic renewals, renewals in case of loss or compromise; and  Rules on the required strength of credentials, together with mechanisms to communicate and enforce the rules;

anchor_text: Asset Onboarding: New assets to be installed into the secure premises are approved by authorized committees or bodies at [The Organization]. The 'on-boarding' of such assets takes place securely according to the type of the asset.
target_text: Acquisition of new components. Is planning carried out prior to the acquisition of new system components, taking into account, for example, the obsolescence of those currently in production, the end of contracts, changes in the context, etc.?. Does the acquisition process take into account the conclusions of the risk analysis, or does it result in a new iteration of said analysis having to be carried out, due to the changes it introduces in the information system? For the new components to be acquired, is it verified that they are consistent or compatible with the security architecture implemented or chosen for the organization? Is there a formalized planning process for the acquisition of new components? Does the procurement process take into account financial, training and technical needs (features, configuration, support and maintenance)?

anchor_text: Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology: A documented Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: Online Register of Known Vulnerabilities: The Cloud Service Provider operates or refers to a daily updated online register of known vulnerabilities that affect the Cloud Service Provider and assets provided by the Cloud Service Provider that the cloud customers have to install, provide or operate themselves under the customers responsibility. The presentation of the vulnerabilities follows the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS). The online register is easily accessible to any cloud customer. The information contained therein forms a suitable basis for risk assessment and possible follow-up measures on the part of cloud users. For each vulnerability, it is indicated whether software updates (e.g. patch, update) are available, when they will be rolled out and whether they will be deployed by the Cloud Service Provider, the cloud customer or both of them together. Assets provided by the Cloud Service Provider, which must be installed, provided or operated by cloud users within their area of responsibility, are equipped with automatic update mechanisms. After approval by the respective cloud user, software updates can be rolled out in such a way that they can be distributed to all affected users without human interaction.

anchor_text: The CSP shall restrict to authorized users only the access to system components used for logging and monitoring under their responsibility
target_text: Logging and Monitoring - Configuration: Access to system components for logging and monitoring in the Cloud Service Provider’s area of responsibility is restricted to authorised users. Changes to the configuration are made in accordance with the applicable policies (cf. DEV-03). Access to system components for logging and monitoring in the Cloud Service Provider´s area of responsibility requires two-factor authentication.

anchor_text: SDLC Methodology: A formal [The Organization] development life cycle (SDLC) methodology is in place that governs the development, acquisition, implementation, changes (including emergency changes), and maintenance of information [The Organization] and related technology requirements.
target_text: Change management. Are changes made to the information system managed?. Are changes planned to reduce the impact on the provision of affected services? For each change request, is enough information recorded so that whoever must authorize it has no doubts about it and can manage it until it is rejected or implemented? Are pre-production tests, whenever possible, carried out on equipment equivalent to production equipment, at least in the specific aspects of the change? Is it determined through risk analysis whether the changes are relevant to the security of the system? Can it be shown that those changes that imply a HIGH risk situation are explicitly approved, prior to their implementation, by the Security Manager in addition to those with the authority assigned to it? Once a change is implemented, are appropriate acceptance tests carried out? If the acceptance tests are positive, is the configuration documentation (network diagrams, manuals, inventory, etc.) updated, where appropriate?

anchor_text: Backup Location: Systems backups are securely stored in an alternate location from source data.
target_text: The CSP shall select a remote location to store its backups concerning the distance, recovery times and the impact of disasters of both sites

anchor_text: Policy and Standard Exceptions: A process is in place to request, review, and approve exceptions to policies, standards, and procedures. The assessment of the exception is risk based and the approved exceptions are reviewed at least annually or based on defined frequency as per [The Organization] policies.
target_text: The CSP shall implement the mitigating measures defined in the risk assessment, privileging separation of duties, unless impossible for organisational or technical reasons, in which case the measures shall include the monitoring of activities in order to detect unauthorised or unintended changes as well as misuse and the subsequent appropriate action

anchor_text: Authorized Session Manager: Privileged logical access to trusted data environments is enabled through an authorized session manager; session user activity is recorded and tunneling to untrusted data environments is restricted.
target_text: The CSP shall design, develop, configure and deploy the information system providing the cloud service to include a partitioning between the technical infrastructure and the equipment required for the administration of the cloud service and the assets it hosts

anchor_text: Infrastructure & Application patching: Infrastructure supporting the service, and applications are patched upon availability as a part of routine maintenance and as a result of identified vulnerabilities and supplier supplied patches to help ensure that applications and infrastructure network and system components supporting the service are hardened against security threats.
target_text: The CSP shall update the anti-malware products at the highest frequency that the vendors actually offer

anchor_text: Network & System Hardening: Network and system hardening standards are documented and reviewed at least annually. These standards are deployed to all networks and production [The Organization]. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the documents themselves and the [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: The service provider must put in place hardening measures of the configuration of the terminals used for administration tasks, in particular those in chapter 4.2 entitled "Safety of the base" of [nt_admin].

anchor_text: Software & Firmware Updates: [The Organization] installs security-relevant software and firmware updates per [The Organization] policy; and incorporates flaw remediation into Systems configuration management process.
target_text: Security configuration management. Is the configuration of system components managed on an ongoing basis?. Is the configuration of system components managed continuously, maintaining the 'minimum functionality' rule at all times? Is the configuration of system components managed continuously, maintaining the 'least privilege' rule at all times? Is the configuration of the system components managed continuously, so that the system adapts to possible new, previously authorized needs? Is the configuration of system components managed continuously, so that the system reacts to possible reported vulnerabilities? Is the configuration of system components managed continuously so that the system reacts to potential incidents? Are the configuration of system components managed on an ongoing basis, so that security settings can only be edited by appropriately authorized personnel?

anchor_text: Limited Audit Trail Access: Audit trails are secured through principles of least privilege to prevent unauthorized access or altering.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a logging policy including at least the following elements: - the list of collection sources

anchor_text: The CSP shall define an asset classification schema that reflects for each asset the protection needs of the information it processes, stores, or transmits
target_text: Asset Classification and Labelling: Assets are classified and, if possible, labelled. Classification and labelling of an asset reflect the protection needs of the information it processes, stores, or transmits. The need for protection is determined by the individuals or groups responsible for the assets of the Cloud Service Provider according to a uniform schema. The schema provides levels of protection for the confidentiality, integrity, availability, and authenticity protection objectives. Logging and monitoring applications take the asset protection needs into account in order to inform the responsible stakeholder of events that could lead to a violation of the protection goals, so that the necessary measures are taken with an appropriate priority. Actions for events on assets with a higher level of protection take precedence over events on assets with a lower need for protection.

anchor_text: The procedure mentioned in AM.03-4 shall include the complete and permanent deletion of the data or the proper destruction of the media.
target_text: COMMISSIONING AND DECOMMISSIONING: Procedures for the commissioning and decommissioning of hardware assets used in the provision of the cloud service are documented, communicated and implemented, ensuring the proper configuration before commissioning and the proper deletion of data during decommissioning.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownHighVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with high rating in the asset
target_text: The CSP shall assess the severity of identified vulnerabilities according to the criteria defined in OPS-17 and measures are taken to immediately eliminate or mitigate them.

anchor_text: Building Fail-Safe Mechanisms: The supply of the data centers (e. g. water, electricity, temperature and moisture control) is secured, monitored, maintained and tested at regular intervals. The data center has been designed with automatic fail-safe mechanisms and other redundancies. Maintenance is performed by authorized personnel at designated intervals and targets recommended by the suppliers. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement measures to ensure that the conditions of installation, maintenance and maintenance of annexed technical equipment (power supply, air conditioning, fire, etc.) are compatible with the service availability requirements defined in the service agreement.

anchor_text: Security & Privacy Incident Response: Privacy and human rights incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must inform its employees and all third parties participating in the implementation of the service of this procedure.

anchor_text: BU Anti-Malware Technology: Where applicable, [The Organization] has managed antivirus deployments and ensures the following: • signature definitions are updated • full scans are performed monthly and real-time scans are enabled • alerts are reviewed and resolved by authorized personnel
target_text: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures for acceptable use and safe handling of assets (reference to ISP-01)

anchor_text: Remote Sessions and logging: Remote access sessions are logged and event logs are retained for review when required.
target_text: Activities of users with privileged access rights shall be logged in order to detect any misuse of privileged access or function in suspicious cases, and the logged information shall be automatically monitored for defined events that may indicate misuse

anchor_text: Cloud Service Legal Jurisdictions: The cloud service provider informs the cloud service customer of the legal jurisdictions governing the cloud service.
target_text: If the CSP expects CSCs to certify with EUCS their own services based on its cloud service using composition, it shall provide specific documentation for them, based on the Complementary Customer Controls (CCCs) that they have defined

anchor_text: Cloud Service Functionality: Systems cloud service provides customers with details around their service functionality, to allow customers the ability to classify and label the information and associated assets.
target_text: The CSP shall include in the description provided for each CCC a list of actionable

anchor_text: Availability Monitoring: Critical [The Organization] are monitored in accordance to predefined availability criteria and alerts are sent to authorized personnel.
target_text: Protection against interruptions caused by power failures and other such risks: Measures to prevent the failure of the technical supply facilities required for the operation of system components with which information from cloud customers is processed, are documented and set up in accordance with the security requirements of the Cloud Service Provider (cf. PS-01 Security Concept) with respect to the following aspects: a) Operational redundancy (N+1) in power and cooling supply b) Use of appropriately sized uninterruptible power supplies (UPS) and emergency power systems (NEA), designed to ensure that all data remains undamaged in the event of a power failure. The functionality of UPS and NEA is checked at least annually by suitable tests and exercises (cf. BCM-04 - Verification, updating and testing of business continuity). c) Maintenance (servicing, inspection, repair) of the utilities in accordance with the manufacturer´s recommendations. d) Protection of power supply and telecommunications lines against interruption, interference, damage and eavesdropping. The protection is checked regularly, but at least every two years, as well as in case of suspected manipulation by qualified personnel regarding the following aspects: . Traces of violent attempts to open closed distributors; . Up-to-datedness of the documentation in the distribution list; . Conformity of the actual wiring and patching with the documentation; . The short-circuits and earthing of unneeded cables are intact; and . Impermissible installations and modifications. Uninterruptible Power Supplies (UPS) and Emergency Power Supplies (NPS) are designed to meet the availability requirements defined in the Service Level Agreement. The cooling supply is designed in such a way that the permissible operating and environmental parameters are also ensured on at least five consecutive days with the highest outside temperatures measured to date within a radius of at least 50 km around the locations of the premises and buildings, with a safety margin of 3 K (in relation to the outside temperature). The Cloud Service Provider has previously determined the highest outdoor temperatures measured to date (cf. PS-01 Security Concept). The connection to the telecommunications network is designed with sufficient redundancy so that the failure of a telecommunications network does not impair the security or performance of the Cloud Service Provider.

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: Any password communicated to a user through e-mail, message or similar shall be changed by the user after its first use, and its validity shall not exceed 14 days after communication to the user

anchor_text: Network & System Hardening: Network and system hardening standards are documented and reviewed at least annually. These standards are deployed to all networks and production [The Organization]. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the documents themselves and the [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: Policies for data transmission: Policies and instructions with technical and organisational safeguards in order to protect the transmission of data against unauthorised interception, manipulation, copying, modification, redirection or destruction are documented, communicated and provided according to SP-01. The policies and instructions establish a reference to the classification of information (cf. AM-06).

anchor_text: Customer data removal: Customer data containing confidential and personal information is purged or removed from the application environment (including backups and data shared with other Offer/Product) upon customer request according to [The Organization] policy and/or contractual obligations.
target_text: At the end of the contract binding the service provider and the sponsor, whether the contract has come to an end or for any other cause, the service provider must ensure a secure erasure of all of the data from the sponsor. This erasure must be the subject of formal notice to the sponsor on the part of the service provider with a period of twenty -one calendar days. The erasure can be carried out according to one of the following methods, and this within a period specified in the service agreement: - Erasure by complete rewriting of any medium that hosted this data; - Erasure of the keys used for the encryption of the storage spaces of the sponsor described in chapter 10.1; - secure recycling, under the conditions set out in chapter 11.9.

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownCriticalVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with critical rating in the asset
target_text: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

anchor_text: Change Approval and Testing Documentation: Changes to service and supporting infrastructure components of the service are authorized, formally documented, tested, reviewed, and approved prior to being implemented in the production environment.
target_text: Code reviews shall be regularly performed by qualified personnel or contractors

anchor_text: Software Vulnerability Scanning: Existing and emerging software vulnerabilities are detected at least monthly, and a vulnerability scan is included upon every code release. Any vulnerabilities identified are assigned a risk rating and reviewed and remediated accordingly.
target_text: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

anchor_text: UsageOfSASTInDevPipeline: The usage of SAST in the Development Pipeline (e.g. GitHub Actions); The number?
target_text: The CSP shall apply appropriate measures to check the cloud service for vulnerabilities that may have been integrated into the cloud service during the development process.

anchor_text: Information Security Policies and Review: Information security policies are documented and define the information security rules and requirements for the service environment. These policies are reviewed at least annually to review requirements and updated as needed. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the policies themselves and the [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: The information security policy must in particular cover the themes addressed to chapters 6 to 19 of this repository.

anchor_text: Change Migrations: Access to migrate changes to production is restricted to authorized personnel. All change migrations are tracked and notifications are sent when changes are migrated to production.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure to control the installation of software on service system equipment.

anchor_text: Security Incident Management: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: Activities of users with privileged access rights shall be logged in order to detect any misuse of privileged access or function in suspicious cases, and the logged information shall be automatically monitored for defined events that may indicate misuse

anchor_text: Supplier sharing agreements and review: Formal Legal Approved information sharing agreements are in place with related critical suppliers. These agreements include confidentiality commitments applicable to that entity.
target_text: Outsourcing of the development: In the case of outsourced development of the cloud service (or individual system components), specifications regarding the following aspects are contractually agreed between the Cloud Service Provider and the outsourced development contractor: . Security in software development (requirements, design, implementation, tests and verifications) in accordance with recognised standards and methods; . Acceptance testing of the quality of the services provided in accordance with the agreed functional and non-functional requirements; and . Providing evidence that sufficient verifications have been carried out to rule out the existence of known vulnerabilities.

anchor_text: File Integrity Monitoring: A file integrity monitoring (FIM) tool is used to notify system administrators of potential unauthorized changes to the production system.
target_text: Change management. Are changes made to the information system managed?. Are changes planned to reduce the impact on the provision of affected services? For each change request, is enough information recorded so that whoever must authorize it has no doubts about it and can manage it until it is rejected or implemented? Are pre-production tests, whenever possible, carried out on equipment equivalent to production equipment, at least in the specific aspects of the change? Is it determined through risk analysis whether the changes are relevant to the security of the system? Can it be shown that those changes that imply a HIGH risk situation are explicitly approved, prior to their implementation, by the Security Manager in addition to those with the authority assigned to it? Once a change is implemented, are appropriate acceptance tests carried out? If the acceptance tests are positive, is the configuration documentation (network diagrams, manuals, inventory, etc.) updated, where appropriate?

anchor_text: Access to Production & Multi-Factor Authentication: Access to production [The Organization] is restricted to authorized employees with a valid multi-factor (MFA) token and over an encrypted connection when applicable.
target_text: Authentication mechanisms (external users). Is the security of external user accounts and credentials maintained through access control mechanisms?

anchor_text: SDLC Methodology: A formal [The Organization] development life cycle (SDLC) methodology is in place that governs the development, acquisition, implementation, changes (including emergency changes), and maintenance of information [The Organization] and related technology requirements.
target_text: The CSP shall include information security in the project management of all projects that may affect the service, regardless of the nature of the project

anchor_text: The CSP shall assess the penetration test findings and handle each identified vulnerability according to defined policies and procedures (cf. OPS-18).
target_text: SEPARATION OF DATASETS IN THE CLOUD INFRASTRUCTURE: System components are hardened to reduce their attack surface and eliminate potential attack vectors.

anchor_text: Policies and Standard Review: Systems policies and standards are reviewed, approved by management, and communicated to authorized personnel periodically. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the policies and standards themselves and the [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: The service provider must document the operating procedures, keep them up to date and make them accessible to the staff concerned.

anchor_text: System Description & Boundaries: [The Organization] has prepared a description of the system and its boundaries and has provided this description to internal and external authorized users.
target_text: In liaison with the inventory of assets (cf. AM-01), the documentation shall include the equipment that provides security functions and the servers that host the data or provide sensitive functions.

anchor_text: Firewall DMZ: Firewalls configure and utilize a DMZ to limit inbound and outbound traffic to only system components that provide authorized publicly accessible services, protocols, and ports.
target_text: The CSP shall set up and configure an application firewall in order to protect the administration interfaces intended for CSCs and exposed over a public network

anchor_text: Control Self-Assessments: Independent Control self-assessments are performed by independent auditors, at least annually, to gain reasonable assurance that controls are in place and operating effectively. Corrective actions are taken based on relevant findings and tracked to resolution. Independent control self-assessments are reviewed by management and stored in a central repository and maintained.
target_text: Internal audits of the information security management system: Subject matter experts check the compliance of the information security management system at regular intervals, at least annually, with the relevant and applicable legal, regulatory, self-imposed or contractual requirements (cf. COM-01) as well as compliance with the policies and instructions (cf. SP-01) within their scope of responsibility (cf. OIS-01) through internal audits (cf. § 9.2 of ISO/IEC 27001). Identified vulnerabilities and deviations are subject to risk assessment in accordance with the risk management procedure (cf. OIS-06) and follow-up measures are defined and tracked (cf. OPS-18). Internal audits are supplemented by procedures to automatically monitor applicable requirements of policies and instructions with regard to the following aspects: . Configuration of system components to provide the cloud service within the Cloud Service Provider´s area of responsibility; . Performance and availability of these system components; . Response time to malfunctions and security incidents; . Recovery time (time to completion of error handling); Identified vulnerabilities and deviations are automatically reported to the appropriate Cloud Service Provider’s subject matter experts for immediate assessment and action. Cloud customers can view compliance with selected contractual requirements in real time.

anchor_text: Physical Access Review: [The Organization] performs physical access account reviews at least semi-annually; corrective action is taken where applicable.
target_text: The service provider must set up a journalization of physical access to sensitive areas. He must make a review of these newspapers at least monthly.

anchor_text: Documented BC/DR: A documented business continuity/disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan is in place and tested at least annually. Enterprise testing is done by the IT Risk Management Team. Offer teams perform testing for their given offers. Any exclusions are documented as part of the BC/DR plan. As part of the BC/DR plan, management identifies rooms for improvement and implements necessary actions to improve their business continuity plan as well.
target_text: The CSP shall document and implement a business continuity plan and contingency plans to ensure continuity of the services, taking into account information security constraints and the results of the business impact analysis

anchor_text: NumberOfKnownHighVulnerabilities: The number of detected known vulnerabilities with high rating in the asset
target_text: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

anchor_text: PruneDisabledAccounts
target_text: The CSP shall implement the process in IAM-03.5 on all user accounts under its responsibility

anchor_text: Training for Development and Growth: [The Organization] uses a learning experience platform called Degreed, which empowers employees to choose how they would like to learn about a specific skill or topic.
target_text: Training. Are the organization's personnel regularly trained in those matters related to information security that are required to perform their functions?. Is there a general Training Plan, oriented to the needs of the staff, that includes training actions regarding information security, which includes the specific training carried out by the organization's staff and the training planned to be carried out? Does the training include, at least, what is related to system configuration, detection and reaction to incidents and information management in any medium in which it is found? Is the training given to general staff different from that specific to managers, technicians and especially people with security responsibilities? Is the effectiveness of the training actions carried out evaluated? Is there control of the attendees of each of the training actions, whether they are taught in person, directly remotely through online videoconferencing platforms, or deferred remotely from platforms with access to 'canned' courses accessible at the pace of the person taking them? Are specific training or specific security certifications requested from external personnel hired in a service provision modality, based on performance?

anchor_text: Audit Program: A three-year audit program is in place which defines the scope and frequency of audits in accordance with change management, policies, and risk assessment results.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an audit program over three years defining the perimeter and frequency of audits in accordance with change management, policies, and the results of risk assessment. The service provider must include in the audit program an audit qualified per year carried out by an audit provider for qualified information systems [PASSI]. The entire audit program must in particular cover: - the audit of the configuration of the technical infrastructure of the service. This audit is carried out by sampling and must include all types of equipment and servers present in the service information system; - the intrusion test of administration interfaces exposed on a public network; - the Intrusion test of the user interface for SaaS services; - If the service benefits from internal developments, the source code audit relating to the security functionalities implemented (the continuous approach must be favored). IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

anchor_text: Monitor of Installed Software: [The Organization] monitors all user installed software, and validates whether or not the software is appropriate. Any inappropriate software installed is immediately removed.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure to control the installation of software on service system equipment.

anchor_text: Firewall DMZ: Firewalls configure and utilize a DMZ to limit inbound and outbound traffic to only system components that provide authorized publicly accessible services, protocols, and ports.
target_text: In the event that the technical infrastructure administration network is not subject to physical partitioning, administration flows must pass through a quantified tunnel, in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

anchor_text: Security Incident Management: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must set up the horoditing of each journalized event.

anchor_text: Security Policy Audit: At least quarterly, [The Organization] reviews shall be performed with approved documented specification to confirm personnel are following security policies and operational procedures pertaining to: • log reviews • firewall rule-set reviews • applying configuration standards to new [The Organization] • responding to security alerts • change management processes
target_text: The policies and procedures shall cover at least the following aspects: Substantial EUCS – CLOUD SERVICES SCHEME December 2020 Ref Description Ass. Level  Definition of events that could lead to a violation of the protection goals;  Specifications for activating, stopping and pausing the various logs;  Information regarding the purpose and retention period of the logs;  Define roles and responsibilities for setting up and monitoring logging;  Time synchronisation of system components; and  Compliance with legal and regulatory frameworks.

anchor_text: Customer Data Protection: Data protection policies are in place to help ensure that confidential, personal and sensitive customer data is properly secured and restricted to authorized personnel. Included are policies of how CUI (Controlled Unclassified Information) data is handled.
target_text: CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS FOR THE PROVISION OF DATA: Contractual agreements define adequate information with regard to the migration of data following the termination of the contractual relationship.

anchor_text: The CSP shall protect security perimeters with security measures to detect and prevent unauthorised access in a timely manner so that it does not compromise the information security of the cloud service
target_text: WORKING IN NON-PUBLIC AREAS: There are specific rules regarding work in non-public areas, to be applied by all employees who have access to these security areas.

anchor_text: Security Bulletin and Email Alerts: [The Organization] or Business Unit (BU) subscribes to relevant security bulletins and email alerts and uses them to monitor the impact of emerging technologies and security.
target_text: The CSP shall consult regularly the online registers published by its subservice providers and suppliers, analyse the potential impact of the published vulnerabilities on the cloud service, and handle them according to the vulnerability handling process (cf. OPS-17)

anchor_text: The CSP shall make the information available to CSCs via documented interfaces that are suitable for further processing this information as part of their Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). December 2020
target_text: IMAGES FOR VIRTUAL MACHINES AND CONTAINERS: Services for providing and managing virtual machines and containers to customers include appropriate protection measures.

anchor_text: Building Safeguards: Environmental security measures and safeguards are in place to protect the premises or buildings that house sensitive or critical information against environmental threats or threats caused by humans.
target_text: The CSP shall document and communicate a set of security requirements related to external and environmental threats in a policy according to SP-02, addressing the following risks in accordance with the applicable legal and contractual requirements:  Faults in planning;  Unauthorised access;  Insufficient surveillance;  Insufficient air-conditioning;  Fire and smoke;  Water;  Power failure; and  Air ventilation and filtration.

anchor_text: Cloud Access Management: [The Organization] provides access controls to its cloud service customer to restrict access to its cloud services, cloud service functions, and data.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure to ensure the allocation, modification and withdrawal of access rights to the resources of the service system.

anchor_text: Communication on these interfaces shall use standardised communication protocols that ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the transmitted information according to its protection requirements
target_text: DOCUMENTATION AND SECURITY OF INPUT AND OUTPUT INTERFACES: Inbound and outbound interfaces to/from the cloud service are documented for access from other cloud services or IT systems.

anchor_text: Access to Production & Multi-Factor Authentication: Access to production [The Organization] is restricted to authorized employees with a valid multi-factor (MFA) token and over an encrypted connection when applicable.
target_text: Authentication mechanisms (organization users). Are access control mechanisms implemented, aligned with the organization's employee/internal user registration and cancellation process?. Are credentials activated only when they are under the user's exclusive and effective control, or is a credential change forced upon first access? Before providing credentials to users, have they known and accepted the organization's security policy in the aspects that affect them? Does the user acknowledge that they have received the credentials and that they know and accept the obligations that their possession entails, in particular, the duty of diligent custody, protection of their confidentiality and immediate notification in the event of loss? Are credentials changed with the periodicity established by the organization's policy? Are credentials removed and disabled when the authenticating entity (person, computer, or process) terminates its relationship with the system? Are credentials disabled or regenerated when their loss or disclosure to unauthorized persons is detected or suspected? Are attacks that could reveal system information without actually accessing it being prevented? Is the information provided in the accesses restricted to the minimum essential? Is the number of allowed attempts limited, blocking the access opportunity once that number is exceeded, requiring the intervention of security administrators to reactivate the account? Does the system inform the user of their obligations immediately after gaining access?

anchor_text: Change Migrations: Access to migrate changes to production is restricted to authorized personnel. All change migrations are tracked and notifications are sent when changes are migrated to production.
target_text: Segregation of duties and tasks. Are those functions segregated that, under certain circumstances, could lead to a conflict of interest, such as, for example, development and operation?. Is it avoided, whenever possible, that development and operation capabilities fall to the same person or the same team? Is it avoided, whenever possible, that the people who authorize are the same people who control the use?

anchor_text: Training for Development and Growth: Training is provided to employees to support their continued development and growth.
target_text: Awareness. Are the necessary actions taken to regularly raise staff awareness about their role and responsibility so that the security of the system reaches the required levels?. Is there a minimum annual planning, which can be adjusted depending on the circumstances, regarding awareness actions and campaigns? Are security regulations regarding the proper use of equipment or systems and the most common social engineering techniques regularly recalled in awareness-raising actions? Are awareness-raising actions periodically reminded of the identification of suspicious incidents, activities or behaviors that must be reported to allow their treatment by specialized personnel, as well as the need to notify them without delay through established channels? Is the procedure for reporting security incidents, whether real or false alarms, periodically recalled in awareness-raising actions?

anchor_text: Network Security Monitoring: An intrusion detection system (IDS) or intrusion prevention system (IPS) are used to provide continuous monitoring of the Systems network and early detection of potential security breaches.
target_text: Protection of integrity and authenticity. Are mechanisms used to guarantee the authenticity and integrity of communications with the outside world?. In communications with points outside the security domain itself, is the authenticity of the other end of the communication channel ensured before exchanging information? Are active attacks prevented by guaranteeing that when they are detected, the procedures planned to deal with the incident will be activated? Are only those provided for in the regulations implementing the legal system used as identification and authentication mechanisms?

anchor_text: Asset Onboarding: New assets to be installed into the secure premises are approved by authorized committees or bodies at [The Organization]. The 'on-boarding' of such assets takes place securely according to the type of the asset.
target_text: The procedure mentioned in AM-03.1 shall ensure that the risks arising from the commissioning are identified, analysed and mitigated.

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: Approval from authorised personnel or system components is required to unlock accounts locked automatically

anchor_text: Full Time Worker Termination: Upon termination, all privileged access held by a terminated employee is revoked within 48 hours.
target_text: The procedure mentioned in HR-05.2 shall define specific roles and responsibilities and include a documented checklist of all required steps

anchor_text: Building Fail-Safe Mechanisms: The supply of the data centers (e. g. water, electricity, temperature and moisture control) is secured, monitored, maintained and tested at regular intervals. The data center has been designed with automatic fail-safe mechanisms and other redundancies. Maintenance is performed by authorized personnel at designated intervals and targets recommended by the suppliers. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.
target_text: The provider must document and implement the measures to prevent and limit the consequences of a power outage and allow a resumption of service in accordance with the service availability requirements defined in the service agreement.

anchor_text: Full Time Worker Termination: Upon termination, all privileged access held by a terminated employee is revoked within 48 hours.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a registration and unsubscription procedure for users based on a management and access rights interface. This procedure must indicate which data should be deleted at the start of a user.

anchor_text: Customer Retention and Disposal Policies: Formal retention and disposal procedures are in place to guide the secure retention and disposal of customer and personal data.
target_text: The cloud customer's data deletion procedures shall prevent recovery by forensic means

anchor_text: Cloud Provider Vulnerability Detection: The cloud service provider provides information about the management of technical vulnerabilities that can impact customers.
target_text: The online register shall indicate at least the following information for every vulnerability:  A presentation of the vulnerability following an industry-accepted scoring system;  A description of the remediation options for that vulnerability;  Information on the availability of updates or patches for that vulnerability;  Information about the remediation or deployment of patches or updates by the CSP or CSC, including detailed instructions for operations to be performed by the CSC.

anchor_text: Encrypted Media Devices: Portable and removable media devices are encrypted (as per the defined organization policies) or monitored when in use. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 encryption method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an out -of -site transfer procedure of the sponsor, equipment and software. This procedure must require that the service provider will give its written authorization. In all cases, the service provider must implement the means making it possible to guarantee that the level of protection in confidentiality and integrity of assets during their transport is equivalent to that on site.

anchor_text: Supplier sharing agreements and review: Formal Legal Approved information sharing agreements are in place with related critical suppliers. These agreements include confidentiality commitments applicable to that entity.
target_text: In accordance with contractual requirements, the CSP shall involve CSCs into the tests.

anchor_text: System Description & Boundaries: [The Organization] has prepared a description of the system and its boundaries and has provided this description to internal and external authorized users.
target_text: Documentation of the network topology: The documentation of the logical structure of the network used to provision or operate the Cloud Service, is traceable and up-to-date, in order to avoid administrative errors during live operation and to ensure timely recovery in the event of malfunctions in accordance with contractual obligations. The documentation shows how the subnets are allocated and how the network is zoned and segmented. In addition, the geographical locations in which the cloud customers´ data is stored are indicated.

anchor_text: For the secure storage of keys, the key management system shall be separated from the application and middleware levels
target_text: Secure key management: Procedures and technical safeguards for secure key management in the area of responsibility of the Cloud Service Provider include at least the following aspects: . Generation of keys for different cryptographic systems and applications; . Issuing and obtaining public-key certificates; . Provisioning and activation of the keys; . Secure storage of keys (separation of key management system from application and middleware level) including description of how authorised users get access; . Changing or updating cryptographic keys including policies defining under which conditions and in which manner the changes and/or updates are to be realised; . Handling of compromised keys; . Withdrawal and deletion of keys; and . If pre-shared keys are used, the specific provisions relating to the safe use of this procedure are specified separately.

anchor_text: Security Incident Management: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: Incident management log. Is there a process of drawing conclusions and learning from the recorded security incidents?. Are initial, intermediate and final reports, emergency actions and system modifications derived from an incident recorded? Is evidence recorded that can be resolved in a jurisdictional setting, especially when the incident may lead to disciplinary actions on internal staff, on external suppliers or in the prosecution of crimes? As a result of the analysis of the incidents, are those events that should continue to be audited and the need to reduce or increase them reviewed? Is learning carried out, based on the analysis of the recorded incidents, that allows aspects to be improved in the security of the system to be revealed? To learn from incidents, are they recorded, indicating their specific typology and not just differentiating security incidents from non-security incidents?

anchor_text: Password Hashing: [The Organization] uses secure methods and algorithms for saving, displaying, and processing passwords such as hashing functions, and ensures they are obscured and not displayed in plain text.
target_text: The CSP rules and recommendations defined in IAM-08.1 shall address at least the following aspects:  Recommendations on password managers  Recommendation to specifically address classical attacks, including phishing, social attacks, and whaling

anchor_text: Building Fail-Safe Mechanisms: The supply of the data centers (e. g. water, electricity, temperature and moisture control) is secured, monitored, maintained and tested at regular intervals. The data center has been designed with automatic fail-safe mechanisms and other redundancies. Maintenance is performed by authorized personnel at designated intervals and targets recommended by the suppliers. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.
target_text: The security requirements defined in PS-05.1 for datacentres shall be based on criteria which comply with established rules of technology

anchor_text: Cloud User Access Management: [The Organization] provides user access management, authentication functions, secret authentication information, and specifications for customers to access their own instances of Systems cloud services.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure for managing the software environment configuration made available to the sponsor, in particular for their maintenance in security condition.

anchor_text: Risk Assessments and Mitigation Strategy: Risk assessments are performed at least annually. As part of this process, threats and changes (environmental, regulatory, and technological) to service commitments are identified and the risks are formally assessed. The risk assessment includes risk mitigation strategies and acceptance levels based on [The Organization] risk criteria. The risk assessment includes a consideration of the potential for fraud and how fraud may impact the achievement of objectives. The results of the risk assessment are reviewed by leadership at least annually.
target_text: SEPARATION OF DATASETS IN THE CLOUD INFRASTRUCTURE: System components are hardened to reduce their attack surface and eliminate potential attack vectors.

anchor_text: Quarterly Access Reviews: Periodic access reviews are conducted by management for the in-scope system components to ensure that access is restricted appropriately. Tickets are created to remove or modify access as necessary in a timely manner.
target_text: Security settings. Is a security configuration (bastioned) carried out on the equipment prior to putting it into production?. Have the equipment been configured, prior to its entry into operation, removing standard accounts and passwords? Have the equipment been configured, prior to its entry into operation, applying the 'minimum functionality' rule, that is, that the system provides the minimum functionality essential for the organization to achieve its objectives? Have the equipment been configured, prior to its entry into operation, so that the 'default security' rule is applied? Have virtual machines been configured and managed, prior to their entry into operation, in a manner equally secure as that used for physical machines?

anchor_text: Cloud Asset Labeling: Systems assets are labelled in accordance with Systems standards, and have designated owners.
target_text: The information recorded with assets shall include the measures taken to manage the risks associated to the asset through its life cycle

anchor_text: Cloud User Access Management: [The Organization] provides user access management, authentication functions, secret authentication information, and specifications for customers to access their own instances of Systems cloud services.
target_text: As part of a SaaS service, the service provider must offer its sponsors of authentication means with multiple factors for access to end users.

anchor_text: Change Migrations: Access to migrate changes to production is restricted to authorized personnel. All change migrations are tracked and notifications are sent when changes are migrated to production.
target_text: The CSP shall test proposed changes before deployment

anchor_text: The exceptions to a security policy or procedure shall be approved by the top management or authorized body who approved the security policy or procedure
target_text: Exceptions from Existing Policies and Instructions: Exceptions to the policies and instructions for information security as well as respective controls go through the OIS-06 risk management process, including approval of these exceptions and acceptance of the associated risks by the risk owners. The approvals of exceptions are documented, limited in time and are reviewed for appropriateness at least annually by the risk owners.

anchor_text: IdentityTimeSinceLastActivity: The last activity of an active user must be recent
target_text: The limits on authentication attempts used in mechanism IAM-03.3 for user accounts under the responsibility of the CSP shall be based on the risks on the accounts, associated access rights and authentication mechanisms

anchor_text: PasswordPolicyComplianceEnforced: When creating a new password, it must be compliant with the password policy.
target_text: The CSP shall document and implement a policy and procedures about authentication mechanisms, covering at least the following aspects:  The selection of mechanisms suitable for every type of account and each level of risk;  The protection of credentials used by the authentication mechanism;  The generation and distribution of credentials for new accounts;  Rules for the renewal of credentials, including periodic renewals, renewals in case of loss or compromise; and  Rules on the required strength of credentials, together with mechanisms to communicate and enforce the rules;

anchor_text: The CSP shall update the anti-malware products at the highest frequency that the vendors actually offer
target_text: PROTECTION AGAINST MALWARE – POLICIES: Policies are defined that ensure the protection against malware of IT equipment related to the cloud service.

anchor_text: Physical Access Monitoring: All Physical access is managed through monitoring, maintaining records, and escorting (for visitors). Access records (including visitor access records) to the facilities are kept for at least a year.
target_text: It is recommended that the service provider respects the recommendations of [G_CVAP] for the implementation of the physical access control.

anchor_text: Supplier Management Program: At least annually, management reviews controls within third party assurance reports to ensure that they meet organizational requirements; if control gaps, significant changes, or reported incidents are identified in the assurance reports, management takes action to address the impact the disclosed gaps have on [The Organization].
target_text: The service provider must require third parties participating in the implementation of the service, in their contribution to the service, a level of security at least equivalent to that which he undertakes to maintain in his own security policy. He must do so through requirements, adapted to each third party and his contribution to the service, in specifications or in the security clauses of the partnership agreements. The service provider must include these requirements in contracts concluded with third parties.

anchor_text: Roles and Responsibilities over Security and Control Environment: Management has established defined roles and responsibilities to oversee the implementation of the security and control environment.
target_text: The CSP shall communicate and make available the policies and procedures to all internal and external employees

anchor_text: The CSP shall consult regularly the online registers published by its subservice providers and suppliers, analyse the potential impact of the published vulnerabilities on the cloud service, and handle them according to the vulnerability handling process (cf. OPS-17)
target_text: Online Register of Known Vulnerabilities: The Cloud Service Provider operates or refers to a daily updated online register of known vulnerabilities that affect the Cloud Service Provider and assets provided by the Cloud Service Provider that the cloud customers have to install, provide or operate themselves under the customers responsibility. The presentation of the vulnerabilities follows the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS). The online register is easily accessible to any cloud customer. The information contained therein forms a suitable basis for risk assessment and possible follow-up measures on the part of cloud users. For each vulnerability, it is indicated whether software updates (e.g. patch, update) are available, when they will be rolled out and whether they will be deployed by the Cloud Service Provider, the cloud customer or both of them together. Assets provided by the Cloud Service Provider, which must be installed, provided or operated by cloud users within their area of responsibility, are equipped with automatic update mechanisms. After approval by the respective cloud user, software updates can be rolled out in such a way that they can be distributed to all affected users without human interaction.

anchor_text: Building Perimeter Physical Access: Physical access provisioning to a [organization]'s datacenter requires management approval and documented specification of but not limited to: • account type (e.g., standard, visitor, or supplier) • access privileges granted • intended business purpose • visitor identification method, if applicable • temporary badge issued, if applicable • access start date • access duration (with end date)
target_text: The service provider must document and implement the means making it possible to ensure that visitors are systematically accompanied by the service provider when they access and stays in the private area. The service provider must maintain a trace of the identity of visitors in accordance with the legislation and regulations in force.

anchor_text: Audit Record Capacity: [The Organization] allocates audit record storage capacity in accordance with logging storage and retention requirements; Audit logs are retained for at least one year with one year of data immediately available for analysis.
target_text: The CSP shall retain a history of the software versions and of the systems that are implemented in order to be able to reconstitute, where applicable in a test environment, a complete environment such as was implemented on a given date; the retention time for this history shall be at least the same as that for backups (cf. OPS-06) December 2020

anchor_text: Cloud Provider Vulnerability Detection: The cloud service provider provides information about the management of technical vulnerabilities that can impact customers.
target_text: The CSP shall apply appropriate measures to check the cloud service for vulnerabilities that may have been integrated into the cloud service during the development process.

anchor_text: Cryptography Use: [The Organization] communicates to its cloud service customers when cryptography is used to protect the customer data and provides information and cryptographic technologies to cloud service customers to use.
target_text: The procedures for the use of private and secret keys, including a specific procedure for any exceptions, shall be contractually agreed with the cloud customer

anchor_text: The CSP shall document the implemented measures after a security incident has been processed and, following the contractual agreements, the document shall be sent to the affected customers for final acknowledgment or, if applicable, as confirmation.
target_text: Documentation and reporting of security incidents: After a security incident has been processed, the solution is documented in accordance with the contractual agreements and the report is sent to the affected customers for final acknowledgement or, if applicable, as confirmation. The customer can either actively approve solutions or the solution is automatically approved after a certain period. Information on security incidents or confirmed security breaches is made available to all affected customers. The contract between the Cloud Service Provider and the cloud customer regulates which data is made available to the cloud customer for his own analysis in the event of security incidents.

anchor_text: Monitoring Event Trends: A log management tool is utilized to identify trends that may have a potential impact on the Systems ability to achieve its security and privacy objectives.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an infrastructure allowing the analysis and correlation of events recorded by the journalization system in order to detect events likely to affect the security of the service system, in real time or a posteriori for events going up to six months.

anchor_text: The incident classification mechanism shall include provisions to correlate events. In addition, these correlated events shall themselves be assessed and classified according to their criticality
target_text: Processing of security incidents: Subject matter experts of the Cloud Service Provider, together with external security providers where appropriate, classify, prioritise and perform root-cause analyses for events that could constitute a security incident. The Cloud Service Provider simulates the identification, analysis and defence of security incidents and attacks at least once a year through appropriate tests and exercises (e.g. Red Team training).

anchor_text: Penetration Testing: Penetration testing is performed at least annually. All discovered vulnerabilities must be triaged for criticality and assigned for remediation compliant to the internal S-Rating and SLAs as defined in the internal Standard S-Rating Classification.
target_text: The incident management policy shall include procedures as to how the data of a suspicious system can be collected in a conclusive manner in the event of a security incident

anchor_text: Documented BC/DR: A documented business continuity/disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan is in place and tested at least annually. Enterprise testing is done by the IT Risk Management Team. Offer teams perform testing for their given offers. Any exclusions are documented as part of the BC/DR plan. As part of the BC/DR plan, management identifies rooms for improvement and implements necessary actions to improve their business continuity plan as well.
target_text: Business impact analysis policies and instructions: Policies and instructions to determine the impact of any malfunction to the cloud service or enterprise are documented, communicated and made available in accordance with SP-01. The following aspects are considered as minimum: . Possible scenarios based on a risk analysis; . Identification of critical products and services; . Identify dependencies, including processes (including resources required), applications, business partners and third parties; . Capture threats to critical products and services; . Identification of effects resulting from planned and unplanned malfunctions and changes over time; . Determination of the maximum acceptable duration of malfunctions; . Identification of restoration priorities; . Determination of time targets for the resumption of critical products and services within the maximum acceptable time period (RTO); . Determination of time targets for the maximum reasonable period during which data can be lost and not recovered (RPO); and . Estimation of the resources needed for resumption.

anchor_text: The CSP shall implement automated monitoring to identify vulnerabilities and deviations, which shall be automatically reported to the appropriate CSP’s subject matter experts for immediate assessment and action
target_text: Internal audits of the information security management system: Subject matter experts check the compliance of the information security management system at regular intervals, at least annually, with the relevant and applicable legal, regulatory, self-imposed or contractual requirements (cf. COM-01) as well as compliance with the policies and instructions (cf. SP-01) within their scope of responsibility (cf. OIS-01) through internal audits (cf. § 9.2 of ISO/IEC 27001).
